frameDefinitions: A Figure is located essentially at the same location as a Ground, which is viewed as point-like, or having no important internal or external structure.
A Social_event occurs at which Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity.
An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
An Agent actively (yet not always with success) attempts to keep themselves from participating in an Event.
Individuals first encounter each other and make introductions at a particular Time, Place, or Context.
frameExamples: Sue threw a <t>party</t> for Bob's birthday.
I've <t>arranged</t> a breakfast meeting for you tomorrow morning with Mr. Huntsberger.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
Impressed when he first <t>met</t> Nixon, he had always thought of him as an intelligent man, and believed that Nixon would take a stand for civil rights
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
This role identifies the <fen>Social_event</fen> itself.
<fen>Attendee</fen> is used for the people who come to the <fen>Social_event</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.
The person who makes arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements.
The time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> has arranged the <fen>Event</fen>.
This role describes the time at which the arrangements are made.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has made arrangements for the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The Agent who tries to keep an Event from taking place.
The Event is the action or state of affairs that the Agent wishes to prevent.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Agent</fen> prevents the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place </fen> is where the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to prevent the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The persons (or in rare cases animals) that make each other's acquaintance.
The semantically more prominent one of the two parties when the Individuals are realized separately.
The semantically less prominent of the two parties when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are expressed separately.
The time when the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
The location where the Individuals make each others acquaintance.
listRoleExamples: He was at my shop <fex>on Friday</fex>.
The department <fex><t>picnic</t></fex> was lots of fun.
<fex>Lucy</fex> organized a playdate for little Michael and Marcy.
Lionel organized a meeting <fex>at the local pub</fex> to discuss the bleak future of our organization.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm
<fex>My wife and I</fex> met in college working in the theatre and we will have been married for 30 years in June 2000.
<fex>Melissa Hurley</fex> had never met her neighbor, Richard Congdon ? the dog owner ? until recently, when she and a reporter knocked on his door.
Gossip reports say she either met <fex>Kennedy</fex> while helping him shop for suits at Calvin Klein, or was contacted by him after he saw her jogging in a New York park
I met my wife <fex>2 yrs ago</fex>.
Bill met his  wife <fex>in Poltava, Ukraine</fex>.
